title: Tesla spikes after Elon Musk tells employees the automaker has 'a shot' at delivering a record 100,000 vehicles this quarter (TSLA)
text:
Tesla

Tesla shares surged as much as 6% on Thursday afternoon after CEO Elon Musk told employees that the company had "a shot" at delivering 100,000 vehicles in its third quarter.

Last quarter, the company delivered roughly 95,200 cars, hitting a record.

"Net orders are tracking to reach about 110k, so demand is strong," Musk wrote in the email, first reported by Electrek.

Watch Tesla trade live here.

Tesla shares climbed as much as 6% on Thursday afternoon after CEO Elon Musk told employees that the automaker could deliver a record number of vehicles in its third quarter.

"We have a shot at achieving our first 100,000 vehicle delivery quarter," Musk wrote in the email, first reported by Electrek, adding that "net orders are tracking to reach about 110k, so demand is strong."

The company delivered roughly 95,200 cars last quarter, hitting a record. Tesla has forecast that it will deliver 360,000 to 400,000 vehicles worldwide for the full year.

Read more: Angry shareholders accused Elon Musk of using Tesla and SpaceX to bail out his cousins' solar company for $2.6 billion

Tesla traded at $241.26 per share as of 3:20 p.m. ET, down about 28% year-to-date. The Thursday jump was the stock's biggest intraday surge since July.

The automaker has 12 "buy" ratings, nine "hold" ratings, and 14 "sell" ratings from analysts, with a consensus price target of $271.18, according to Bloomberg data.
